scenes.background: The team has successfully completed an important project, and everyone is excited to organize a celebration. However, there are differing opinions on how to celebrate. Colleague Sam suggests going to a bar for a lively party, Emma prefers a formal dinner, and Ryan proposes an outdoor team-building activity. Alex suggests a bit of everything: starting with an outdoor activity, then having dinner, and ending the night at a bar. Monica and Bob have been discussing this, and you notice some tension as they approach you. Monica crosses her arms and says, 'Alex, do you really think we can fit all that in one evening? And Bob here thinks we should just stick to one thing.' Bob nods in agreement, looking a bit annoyed. After considering their input, Alex suggests going with the majority's preference to avoid any conflicts. Monica and Bob now seem to be waiting for a more concrete plan. Alex decides to stick to Emma's suggestion of a formal dinner to keep things simple. Monica and Bob appear to be processing this decision, with Monica tapping her foot and Bob scratching his head.
scenes.description: Monica frowns and says, 'A formal dinner? Really, Alex? I thought we were aiming for something more exciting.' Bob adds, 'Yeah, I'm not sure everyone will be thrilled with just a dinner.' Both Monica and Bob look at you expectantly.

options.text: Well, a formal dinner can be enjoyable if we make it special. Maybe we can have some fun activities or a surprise element.
options.analysis: This option shows a high level of emotional detection and empathy by trying to make the formal dinner more appealing. It demonstrates good social skills and motivation to keep everyone engaged.

options.text: I see your point. Maybe a formal dinner isn't the best idea. How about we go for the outdoor team-building activity instead?
options.analysis: This choice shows good self-regulation and maintains a calm demeanor, but it may come across as indecisive by changing the plan again.

options.text: If you're both so against it, maybe we should just scrap the whole celebration idea until we can agree on something.
options.analysis: This option shows good social skills by trying to avoid further conflict but demonstrates lower empathy and motivation as it suggests abandoning the celebration altogether.
